titleStmt.title: Obedience perpetually due to kings, because the kingly power is inseparable from the one kings person. Delivered in a sermon to Mr. Peter Gunning's congregation in Exeter Chappel, near the Savoy, on the appointed Thanksgiving-day, June 28. 1660. By William Towers, Batchelor in Divinity, and curate at Upton near Northampton.
titleStmt.author: Towers, William, 1617?-1666.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by R.D. for Thomas Rooks, and are to be sold at his shop at the sign of the Holy Lamb at the east end of S. Paul's,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
